update.description:
This is migrating the functionality added in pull request #2323 to use an ignition transport service rather than gazebo transport requests. 

This is supposed to have better performance than the previous approach, because we don't have a subscriber to `~/response` for each model, link, sensor, visual in the world.

The world provides a service, `<world_name>/server/info/plugin`, which is the single point of entry for all plugin info queries within the server (World, Model, Sensor plugins). Potentially even Visual plugins, since the SDF is within the world.

This pull request changes the logic for model plugins, and future pull requests will use the same approach for other plugin types.

I hope other details are made clear in the documentation.

Obs: There is a [compile warning](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/569/warnings19Result/) left which I need help with.

content.raw:
According to [this](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2437/upgrade-to-ign-transport2/diff#comment-23172999) comment on another PR, ign-transport2 won't be in Xenial, is that a problem for gazebo8?

In fact, I built locally against ign-transport1 and it worked. I added cmake status messages so it's easier to know the version being used: 1881d70
content.html:
According to this comment on another PR, ign-transport2 won't be in Xenial, is that a problem for gazebo8?

In fact, I built locally against ign-transport1 and it worked. I added cmake status messages so it's easier to know the version being used: 1881d70

content.raw: This is a known issue. We decided to hold on any custom solutions for it for now because we will soon (hopefully) be changing the design of the left panel completely. I see what you're saying about removing it from the GUI, but as ugly as it may look, it can be helpful to check parameters, especially if it's short. I don't feel too strongly about it though, we can leave it out for now.
content.html: This is a known issue. We decided to hold on any custom solutions for it for now because we will soon (hopefully) be changing the design of the left panel completely. I see what you're saying about removing it from the GUI, but as ugly as it may look, it can be helpful to check parameters, especially if it's short. I don't feel too strongly about it though, we can leave it out for now.

pullrequest.title: Get plugin info with Ignition transport service

content.raw: I just ran a world with a model plugin and everything seems to work. I can click on the model and I see the plugin with the `name`, `filename` and `innerxml` properties. However, the `innerxml` property is hard to see/use because the content can be arbitrary big and is hard to see it on the widget. My first instinct is to remove it from the GUI unless someone has a more creative idea to visualize it.
content.html: I just ran a world with a model plugin and everything seems to work. I can click on the model and I see the plugin with the name, filename and innerxml properties. However, the innerxml property is hard to see/use because the content can be arbitrary big and is hard to see it on the widget. My first instinct is to remove it from the GUI unless someone has a more creative idea to visualize it.

content.raw:
Done, this saved a dozen lines of code: 462d5ea

I'm returning true only if the result is zero though, because we are only interested if it matches from the beginning. This is written in the documentation, but I realize the function name might be misleading...
content.html:
Done, this saved a dozen lines of code: 462d5ea

I'm returning true only if the result is zero though, because we are only interested if it matches from the beginning. This is written in the documentation, but I realize the function name might be misleading...

content.raw: I feel like `std::string::compare` is more suitable when sorting. For this use case, we need something closer to `std::string::find`. Check out commit c3d8fbe, I implemented `URIPath::Contains`, which behaves like `std::string::find(_other) == 0`.
content.html: I feel like std::string::compare is more suitable when sorting. For this use case, we need something closer to std::string::find. Check out commit c3d8fbe, I implemented URIPath::Contains, which behaves like std::string::find(_other) == 0.

content.html: I think that should work. The only problem I can see is if a path has an extra / in the end, so we might need to remove that before.

content.raw: I think we could add some functionality to the URI class here (lines 1672->1689). You could add a `Compare` function to `URI` that operates in a manner similar to [std::string::compare](http://www.cplusplus.com/reference/string/string/compare/).
content.html: I think we could add some functionality to the URI class here (lines 1672->1689). You could add a Compare function to URI that operates in a manner similar to std::string::compare.

pull_request.title: Get plugin info with Ignition transport service

update.description:
This is migrating the functionality added in pull request #2323 to use an ignition transport service rather than gazebo transport requests. 

This is supposed to have better performance than the previous approach, because we don't have a subscriber to `~/response` for each model, link, sensor, visual in the world.

The world provides a service, `<world_name>/server/info/plugin`, which is the single point of entry for all plugin info queries within the server (World, Model, Sensor plugins). Potentially even Visual plugins, since the SDF is within the world.

This pull request changes the logic for model plugins, and future pull requests will use the same approach for other plugin types.

I hope other details are made clear in the documentation.

Obs: There is a [compile warning](http://build.osrfoundation.org/view/main/view/CI%20any%20jobs/job/gazebo-ci-pr_any-trusty-amd64-gpu-nvidia/569/warnings19Result/) left which I need help with.
update.title: Get plugin info with Ignition transport service
